trans-unit.source: Enumerates the subkeys of the specified open registry key

target.mrk: Enumerates the subkeys of the specified open registry key

target.mrk: Parameters

trans-unit.source: Handle to an open registry key. The key must have been opened with the $KEY_ENUMERATE_SUB_KEYS access

seg-source.mrk: Handle to an open registry key.
The key must have been opened with the $KEY_ENUMERATE_SUB_KEYS access

target.mrk: Handle to an open registry key.
The key must have been opened with the $KEY_ENUMERATE_SUB_KEYS access

trans-unit.source: right. This handle is returned by the _WinAPI_RegCreateKey() or _WinAPI_RegOpenKey() function.

seg-source.mrk: right.
This handle is returned by the _WinAPI_RegCreateKey() or _WinAPI_RegOpenKey() function.

target.mrk: right.
This handle is returned by the _WinAPI_RegCreateKey() or _WinAPI_RegOpenKey() function.

trans-unit.source: It can also be one of the following predefined keys.

seg-source.mrk: It can also be one of the following predefined keys.

target.mrk: It can also be one of the following predefined keys.

seg-source.mrk: $HKEY_CLASSES_ROOT

target.mrk: $HKEY_CLASSES_ROOT

seg-source.mrk: $HKEY_CURRENT_CONFIG

target.mrk: $HKEY_CURRENT_CONFIG

seg-source.mrk: $HKEY_CURRENT_USER

target.mrk: $HKEY_CURRENT_USER

seg-source.mrk: $HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE

target.mrk: $HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE

seg-source.mrk: $HKEY_PERFORMANCE_DATA

target.mrk: $HKEY_PERFORMANCE_DATA

seg-source.mrk: $HKEY_USERS

target.mrk: $HKEY_USERS

trans-unit.source: The index of the subkey to retrieve. This parameter should be zero for the first call to the _WinAPI_RegEnumKey()

trans-unit.source: Sets the @error flag to non-zero, @extended flag may contain the system error code.

trans-unit.source: To enumerate subkeys, an application should initially call the _WinAPI_RegEnumKey() function with the $iIndex

seg-source.mrk: To enumerate subkeys, an application should initially call the _WinAPI_RegEnumKey() function with the $iIndex

target.mrk: To enumerate subkeys, an application should initially call the _WinAPI_RegEnumKey() function with the $iIndex

trans-unit.source: parameter set to zero. The application should then increment the $iIndex parameter and call _WinAPI_RegEnumKey()

seg-source.mrk: parameter set to zero.
The application should then increment the $iIndex parameter and call _WinAPI_RegEnumKey()

target.mrk: parameter set to zero.
The application should then increment the $iIndex parameter and call _WinAPI_RegEnumKey()

trans-unit.source: until there are no more subkeys (meaning the @extended flag sets to ERROR_NO_MORE_ITEMS (259)).

seg-source.mrk: until there are no more subkeys (meaning the @extended flag sets to ERROR_NO_MORE_ITEMS (259)).

target.mrk: until there are no more subkeys (meaning the @extended flag sets to ERROR_NO_MORE_ITEMS (259)).

target.mrk: The application can also set $iIndex to the index of the last subkey on the first call to the function and

trans-unit.source: decrement the index until the subkey with the index 0 is enumerated. To retrieve the index of the last subkey,

trans-unit.source: While an application is using the _WinAPI_RegEnumKey() function, it should not make calls to any registration
